question: Which is the basin country of the "Choluteca River"?
explanation: The Choluteca River is a river in southern Honduras. The mouth of the river, located among wetland, is near the coastal town on the Gulf of Fonseca. Its basin is affected by severe drought together with the El Nino phenomenon, and this is usually associated with severe bush fires. There are no dams built along the main course of the river to leave it to its natural health.
